title: Stinson 2013 Tannat (Monticello)
description: This wine is high-toned with flamboyant aromas of pomegranate, cherry and grape. Cherry is front and center on the palate, with subdued notes of resinous oak and baking spice coming through. Mocha-tinged tannins lead on the finish.

title: Sutcliffe 2013 Hafoty Fawr Red (Colorado)
description: Tart raspberry and blackberry are sharp in this medium- to light-bodied blend, with hints of vanilla and white pepper on the palate. Fleeting tannins leads to a tangy finish.

title: Monte De Oro 2011 Vista del Monte Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Scents of stewed blueberry and black cherry devolve into prunes and raisins on the nose of this bottling, but the dried ginger and dark spice elements add complexity. It's dense on the palate, with strong acidity cutting the meaty quality of the midpalate, with pruney flavors throughout.

title: Hardys 2014 Stamp of Australia Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)
description: Hints of lemon curd and crème brûlée join peach and citrus, finishing with a surprising degree of elegance. Drink up.

title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 Goivo White (Vinho Verde)
description: Soft, medium sweet and fruity, this light, crisp wine is good for quaffing. It's easy on the palate, with a bright, refreshing and clean aftertaste. Drink immediately.

title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 Mariana Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This is one in a range of entry-level wines from Rocim. An attractive, fruity wine, it offers plenty of acidity and citrus flavors. Still young and tight, it needs a few more months, so drink from 2018.

title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 Olho de Mocho Rosé (Alentejano)
description: A bright and fruity wine made from a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this is deliciously refreshing. Its red currant fruits and crisp acidity are light and ready to drink.

title: South Stage 2013 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)
description: Made predominantly from Tempranillo, with 10% Pinot Noir and a splash of Syrah, this is a simple, generic red wine, with light berry flavors and touch of cracker but no specific varietal character.

title: Los Andicos 2016 Selección Especial Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Earthy berry aromas come with woodspice notes. This is raw and acidic on the palate, and overall it feels prickly and a bit disjointed. Saucy plum flavors are salty, while the punch of red-fruit acidity propels a tangy finish.

title: Luigi Bosca 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipú)
description: Plum and berry aromas include notes of lemon and shaved roots. This is a funky Cabernet with choppy tannins that create an abrasive mouthfeel. Salty berry, tomato and oak flavors finish woody.

title: M. & J-F Bertrand 2016 Fleur de Carbonnel Chardonnay (Vin de France)
description: Touches of vanilla and spice give this wine an attractive character. Its light, tangy texture adds crispness that supplements the bright acidity. Drink now.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2016 Weinkellerei Auslese White (Rheinhessen)
description: Hints of summer strawberry and peach show prominently in this medium-sweet white blend. It's a touch confected in sweetness, but light bodied and easy drinking. The finish is brisk.

title: Settlers Rise 2016 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)
description: This bargain-priced offering is simple, fruity and direct, marked by peach and pineapple notes and a silky texture. Drink now.

title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: Tannins predominate over fruit in this closed and tight wine. It should soften a little with time, so look for its red cherry fruit from the end of 2017.

title: Encosta do Sobral 2016 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)
description: This broad, soft wine has hints of spice as well as ripe apricot flavors. The texture is easy and attractive. Drink now.

title: Finca Adelma 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Earthy, murky aromas of cherry and plum lack freshness and brightness. This wine is jammy and a bit clumsy on the palate, with saucy, savory berry and plum flavors. An herbal, jammy-tasting finish leaves you wanting more.

title: Finca El Origen 2016 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Medicinal cherry and plum aromas set up a palate with clipped, hard tannins. Forced flavors of oak and carob are more obvious than the wine's plum and cassis notes. Oak dominates the creamy, charred finish.

title: Fiuza NV 3 Castas Nature Sparkling (Tejo)
description: The Vital grape in the blend gives crisp acidity to this soft wine. Light and lively, it's packed with fruit and has a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Fat Bastard 2016 Malbec (Vin de France)
description: Bright red fruit highlights this soft wine. Acidity and hint of stalky tannins give its red berry flavors a boost. It's easygoing and ready to drink.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Azul Portugal White (Vinho Verde)
description: A dry style of Vinho Verde, this is crisp and cool. Slight petillance adds a lift, brightening the citrus flavors and acidity. Drink now.

title: Zolo 2016 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Flowery, tropical aromas are pure Torrontés, although this one turns to applesauce the longer it breathes. A healthy-feeling but generic palate deals flavors of Thompson seedless white grapes and honeydew. It has a fresh but faint finish.
designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled

title: Ciconia 2016 Ciconia Rosé (Alentejano)
description: A blend of Aragonez, Syrah and Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp wine, full of raspberry fruits and a soft texture. It is attractive with its balance of acidity and fruit, and is very ready to drink.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Paxis Red (Lisboa)
description: This producer is the only grower of Caladoc grapes in Portugal, and one of the few in the world. Blended here with Tinta Roriz, the grape gives a ripe, soft and perfumed wine. It has a generous character, all fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Senses Viognier (Alentejano)
description: This wine is soft and creamy, with the apricot flavor that is characteristic of Viognier. It is a ripe wine, although with a light and spicy aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2016 Bridão Clássico Branco White (Tejo)
description: This blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto offers lime and orange-peel fruitiness. It is smooth and rounded, with touches of caramel and vanilla to give extra richness. Drink now.

title: Alfredo Roca 2016 Roca Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Mild white-fruit aromas are nonspecific but clean. This blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay has a simple, citrusy palate feel and briny nectarine flavors. A briny flavor quality remains on the finish.

title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)
description: This soft, medium-sweet wine comes from one of the oldest producers in the Vinho Verde region, established in 1790. The wine is fruity and crisp, with a light sparkle. Bright lemon acidity comes through strongly at the end.

title: Casanel 2014 Estate Petit Verdot (Middleburg)
description: This wine has is high-toned in aromas with raisin, terriyaki, red currant and charred oak. The palate is a bit muted on the fruit tones, with red currant pervading and secondary characteristics of coffee and chocolate in the background. This is a big wine with chewy tannins, a full body and puckery acidity.

title: Blue Valley 2016 Muskat Ottonel (Middleburg)
description: Showing aromas of overripe mango, peach, lime and white flowers, this wine is intense on the nose. The palate is equally loud, with lime and candied peach standing out. The acidity is prickly and gives a sour taste to the finish.

title: Bowman Cellars 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is smooth and densely packed in earth and blackberry, the overall tone voluptuously concentrated and full bodied, with a tenacious embrace of ripeness.
